perturbation.original_text: "Heritage shall produce the products described on Schedule A attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the "Products"), for Premier at [***] Heritage's or Heritage's wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper's facilities (the "Facilities"). [***]"
perturbation.changed_text: "Heritage shall use commercially reasonable efforts to produce the products described on Schedule A and Schedule A-1 attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the "Products," each individual unit of Product "Unit"), for Premier at [***] Heritage's or Heritage's wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper's facilities (the "Facilities"). [***], except that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, [***]."
perturbation.explanation: The original text states "Heritage shall produce", creating an obligation to produce the products. The modified text changes this to "Heritage shall use commercially reasonable efforts to produce," weakening the obligation. This creates ambiguity regarding the level of commitment required from Heritage.
perturbation.location: Section 3. PRODUCTION OF PRODUCT, a. Section 2(a)

perturbation.original_text: "All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered to Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier as listed on Schedule A, which Schedule may from time to time be modified by Premier in writing (the "Specifications"), shall conform to Post Holding's Quality Expectations Manual attached hereto as Schedule E, and shall conform in all material respects to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage."
perturbation.changed_text: "All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered by Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall generally conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier as listed on Schedule A and/or Schedule A-1, which Schedules may from time to time be modified by Premier in writing (the "Specifications"), shall conform to Post Holding's Quality Expectations Manual attached hereto as Schedule E, and shall represent a good faith effort to conform in all material respects to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage."
perturbation.explanation: The original text states "shall conform to the specifications," creating a strict requirement. The modified text changes this to "shall generally conform to the specifications" and products will "represent a good faith effort to conform in all material respects", weakening the obligation and creating ambiguity about the acceptable level of deviation from the specifications. This creates an internal contradiction with other sections requiring strict adherence.
perturbation.location: Section 3. PRODUCTION OF PRODUCT, h. Section 2(o)(i)

perturbation.original_text: "Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in Schedule C to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on Schedule C."
perturbation.changed_text: "Heritage shall endeavor to purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***]."
perturbation.explanation: The original text states "Heritage shall purchase all ingredients", creating an obligation. The modified text changes this to "Heritage shall endeavor to purchase all ingredients", weakening this obligation. This creates ambiguity about what happens if Heritage is unable to purchase certain ingredients, and how that impacts production and invoicing. It's an internal contradiction if other clauses assume Heritage's full procurement responsibility.
perturbation.location: Section 4. Section 3 DELIVER, PRICING, BILLING AND PAYMENT, a. Section 3(b)
